requirement: The contractor must provide field-wide deployment and maintenance of telecommunications intercept collection systems in support of criminal investigations.
The contractor must support the CALEA network which receives, processes, buffers and transmits court authorized intercepted communications.

Provide CALEA network support, system administration, system engineering support, virtual environment support, Active Directory OU administration support, storage administration support, CALEA architecture support, and COOP site support
Provide field operations support, technical service support, and inventory support
Comply with latest technology standards, architecture policies, processes and procedures applicable to ICE IT environment

Comply with DHS 4300A Sensitive Systems Handbook, DHS 4300A Sensitive Systems Policy Directive, DHS 4300B National Security Systems Handbook, DHS Management Directive 4300, DHS MD 4010.2 on Section 508 accessibility
Comply with NIST Computer Security Resources Center standards, guidelines, and special publications

Comply with ICE Technical Reference Model, ICE Application Security Cyber Security Standard, ICE Architecture Test and Evaluation Plan, ICE Cybersecurity Standards, ICE Enterprise Systems Assurance Plan, ICE System Lifecycle Management Handbook, ICE Web Standards and Guidelines
Comply with the Privacy Act of 1974 and Section 508 of the Rehabilitation Act
All IT hardware or software shall comply with the DHS Enterprise Architecture and ICE Technical Reference Model Standards and Products Profile
All encryption shall be FIPS 197 AES that is FIPS 140-2 certified
All data assets, information exchanges, and data standards shall comply with requirements, whether adopted or developed
All solutions and services shall meet DHS Enterprise Architecture (EA) policies, standards, and procedures
All developed solutions and requirements shall be compliant with the DHS EA

Development of data assets, information exchanges and data standards will comply with the DHS Enterprise Data Management Policy Directive 103-01 and all data-related artifacts will be developed and validated according to DHS data management architectural guidelines
In compliance with Office of Management and Budget (OMB) mandate, all network hardware shall be Internet Protocol version 6 (IPv6) compatible without modification, upgrade, or replacement
The Contractor shall not deviate from the SLM process without express approval granted by the Contracting Officer's Representative (COR)
The application must be IPv6 compliant as defined in the U.S. Government Version 6 (USGv6) Profile and the USGv6 Test Program.
The application must be designed for browser independence and work with major browsers like Chrome for Work.
The application should utilize a responsive web design approach for optimal viewing across platforms.
The contractor must ensure the application is compatible with future versions of browsers used by ICE.
Follow the ICE Open Source Manifesto when evaluating technologies, tools, software, and APIs
Provide qualified, experienced personnel to perform the required services and support tasks
Proficiently manage well-qualified IT professionals located across the Continental United States and U.S. territories
Provide CALEA network support services
